016package squidpony.squidmath;
017
018import squidpony.annotation.GwtIncompatible;
019
020import java.io.Serializable;
021import java.util.*;
022
023/**
024 * An int-key and int-value insertion-ordered hash map with with a fast implementation, originally from fastutil as
025 * Object2ObjectLinkedOpenHashMap but modified (in {@link OrderedMap}) to support constant-time indexed access of keys,
026 * values, and entries, and reordering. Deletion is slower with this algorithm (O(n) because the array used to keep
027 * track of ordering and indexing only allows linear-time deletion, instead of a linked-list approach allowing
028 * constant-time deletion but not helping at all with indexed access), and insertion sometimes takes longer than an
029 * ordered map using a linked-list for order because rehashing is more expensive. The benefits from constant-time access
030 * by index are numerous, especially for games, since fetching a random element becomes O(1) instead of O(n), and the
031 * index can be used to store extra info for no cost.
032 * <br>
033 * An older version of this class didn't support the useful {@link #keyAt(int)} and {@link #getAt(int)} operations,
034 * among many others, and a refactor of the class has made it much closer to {@link IntIntOrderedMap} and to some extent
035 * {@link OrderedMap}, making order control a priority. Some method names have changed; if you used code like
036 * {@code putAndMoveToFirst(k, v)}, that should be replaced with {@code putAt(k, v, 0)}. The API for the data structures
037 * returned by {@link #keySet()} and {@link #values()} has changed in some places; you should use
038 * {@link #keysAsArray()} and {@link #valuesAsArray()} instead of creating a key set or values collection and calling
039 * toArray() on that, as you had to before. The usage of this class should now be similar to the rest of the library.
040 * <br>
041 * Instances of this class use a hash table to represent a map. The table is filled up to a specified <em>load factor</em>, and then doubled in size to accommodate new entries. If the table is
042 * emptied below <em>one fourth</em> of the load factor, it is halved in size. However, halving is not performed when deleting entries from an iterator, as it would interfere with the iteration
043 * process.
044 * <br>
045 * Note that {@link #clear()} does not modify the hash table size. Rather, a family of {@linkplain #trim() trimming methods} lets you control the size of the table; this is particularly useful if
046 * you reuse instances of this class.
047 * <br>
048 * Iterators generated by this map will enumerate pairs in the same order in which they have been added to the map (addition of pairs whose key is already present in the set does not change the
049 * iteration order). Note that this order has nothing in common with the natural order of the keys. The order is kept by means of a int-specialized list, {@link IntVLA}, and is modifiable with this
050 * class' {@link #reorder(int...)} and {@link #shuffle(IRNG)} methods, among other tools. It may be preferable to avoid instantiating an Iterator object and instead
051 * use a normal int-based for loop with {@link #getAt(int)} called in each iteration. Though this doesn't allow easy deletion of items during iteration, it may be the
052 * fastest way to iterate through an OrderedMap.
053 * <br>
054 * This class allows approximately constant-time lookup of keys or values by their index in the ordering, which can
055 * allow some novel usage of the data structure. {@link OrderedSet} can be used like a list of unique elements, keeping
056 * order like a list does but also allowing rapid checks for whether an item exists in the OrderedSet, and OrderedMap
057 * can be used like that but with values associated as well (where OrderedSet uses contains(), OrderedMap uses
058 * containsKey()). You can also set the key and value at a position with {@link #putAt(int, double, int)}, or alter
059 * the key while keeping its value and index the same with {@link #alter(int, int)}. Reordering works here too,
060 * both with completely random orders from {@link #shuffle(IRNG)} or with a previously-generated ordering from
061 * {@link #reorder(int...)} (you can produce such an ordering for a given size and reuse it across multiple Ordered data
062 * structures with {@link IRNG#randomOrdering(int)}). Note that putAt() and {@link #removeAt(int)} do not run in constant
063 * time, and depending on the point of insertion/removal, they are likely to run in linear time (but also note that most
064 * insertion-ordered Maps and Sets don't allow insertion or removal at anywhere but the beginning or end of the order).
065 * <br>
066 * This doesn't allow custom IHashers because IHasher expects an Object to hash, and that would box the keys every time.
067 * <br>
068 * Thank you, Sebastiano Vigna, for making FastUtil available to the public with such high quality.
069 * <br>
070 * See https://github.com/vigna/fastutil for the original library.
071 * @author Sebastiano Vigna (responsible for all the hard parts)
072 * @author Tommy Ettinger (mostly responsible for squashing several layers of parent classes into one monster class)
073 */
074public class IntDoubleOrderedMap implements Serializable, Cloneable {
075    private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
076    /**
077     * The array of keys.
078     */
079    protected int[] key;
080    /**
081     * The array of values.
082     */
083    protected double[] value;
084    /**
085     * The mask for wrapping a position counter.
086     */
087    protected int mask;
088    /**
089     * Whether this set contains the key zero.
090     */
091    protected boolean containsNullKey;
092    /**
093     * An IntVLA (variable-length int sequence) that stores the positions in the key array of specific keys, with the
094     * positions in insertion order. The order can be changed with {@link #reorder(int...)} and other methods.
095     */
096    protected IntVLA order;
097    /**
098     * The current table size.
099     */
100    protected int n;
101    /**
102     * Threshold after which we rehash. It must be the table size times {@link #f}.
103     */
104    protected int maxFill;
105    /**
106     * Number of entries in the set (including the key zero, if present).
107     */
108    protected int size;
109    /**
110     * The acceptable load factor.
111     */
112    public final float f;
113    /**
114     * Cached set of entries.
115     */
116    protected volatile MapEntrySet entries;
117    /**
118     * Cached set of keys.
119     */
120    protected volatile KeySet keys;
121    /**
122     * Cached collection of values.
123     */
124    protected volatile ValueCollection values;
125    /**
126     * Default return value.
127     */
128    protected double defRetValue = Double.NaN;
129
130    /**
131     * The initial default size of a hash table.
132     */
133    public static final int DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE = 16;
134    /**
135     * The default load factor of a hash table.
136     */
137    public static final float DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR = .25f; // .1875f; // .75f;
138    /**
139     * The load factor for a (usually small) table that is meant to be particularly fast.
140     */
141    public static final float FAST_LOAD_FACTOR = .5f;
142    /**
143     * The load factor for a (usually very small) table that is meant to be extremely fast.
144     */
145    public static final float VERY_FAST_LOAD_FACTOR = .25f;
146
147    public void defaultReturnValue(final double rv) {
148        defRetValue = rv;
149    }
150
151    public double defaultReturnValue() {
152        return defRetValue;
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Creates a new OrderedMap.
157     * <p>
158     * <p>The actual table size will be the least power of two greater than <code>expected</code>/<code>f</code>.
159     *
160     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the hash set.
161     * @param f        the load factor.
162     */
163
164    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
165    public IntDoubleOrderedMap(final int expected, final float f) {
166        if (f <= 0 || f > 1)
167            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Load factor must be greater than 0 and smaller than or equal to 1");
168        if (expected < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The expected number of elements must be nonnegative");
169        this.f = f;
170        n = arraySize(expected, f);
171        mask = n - 1;
172        maxFill = maxFill(n, f);
173        key = new int[n + 1];
174        value = new double[n + 1];
175        //link = new long[n + 1];
176        order = new IntVLA(expected);
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Creates a new OrderedMap with 0.75f as load factor.
181     *
182     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the OrderedMap.
183     */
184    public IntDoubleOrderedMap(final int expected) {
185        this(expected, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Creates a new OrderedMap with initial expected 16 entries and 0.75f as load factor.
190     */
191    public IntDoubleOrderedMap() {
192        this(DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Creates a new OrderedMap copying a given one.
197     *
198     * @param m a {@link Map} to be copied into the new OrderedMap.
199     * @param f the load factor.
200     */
201    public IntDoubleOrderedMap(final IntDoubleOrderedMap m, final float f) {
202        this(m.size(), f);
203        putAll(m);
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * Creates a new OrderedMap with 0.75f as load factor copying a given one.
208     *
209     * @param m a {@link Map} to be copied into the new OrderedMap.
210     */
211    public IntDoubleOrderedMap(final IntDoubleOrderedMap m) {
212        this(m, m.f);
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Creates a new OrderedMap using the elements of two parallel arrays.
217     *
218     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new OrderedMap.
219     * @param valueArray the array of corresponding values in the new OrderedMap.
220     * @param f the load factor.
221     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
222     */
223    public IntDoubleOrderedMap(final int[] keyArray, final double[] valueArray, final float f) {
224        this(keyArray.length, f);
225        if (keyArray.length != valueArray.length)
226            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The key array and the value array have different lengths (" + keyArray.length + " and " + valueArray.length + ")");
227        for (int i = 0; i < keyArray.length; i++)
228            put(keyArray[i], valueArray[i]);
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Creates a new OrderedMap with 0.75f as load factor using the elements of two parallel arrays.
233     *
234     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new OrderedMap.
235     * @param valueArray the array of corresponding values in the new OrderedMap.
236     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
237     */
238    public IntDoubleOrderedMap(final int[] keyArray, final double[] valueArray) {
239        this(keyArray, valueArray, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
240    }
241    private int realSize() {
242        return containsNullKey ? size - 1 : size;
243    }
244    private void ensureCapacity(final int capacity) {
245        final int needed = arraySize(capacity, f);
246        if (needed > n)
247            rehash(needed);
248    }
249    private void tryCapacity(final long capacity) {
250        final int needed = (int) Math.min(
251                1 << 30,
252                Math.max(2, HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((long) Math.ceil(capacity
253                        / f))));
254        if (needed > n)
255            rehash(needed);
256    }
257    private double removeEntry(final int pos) {
258        final double oldValue = value[pos];
259        size--;
260        fixOrder(pos);
261        shiftKeys(pos);
262        if (size < (maxFill >> 2) && n > DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE)
263            rehash(n >> 1);
264        return oldValue;
265    }
266    private double removeNullEntry() {
267        containsNullKey = false;
268        final double oldValue = value[n];
269        size--;
270        fixOrder(n);
271        if (size < (maxFill >> 2) && n > DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE)
272            rehash(n >> 1);
273        return oldValue;
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * Puts the first key in keyArray with the first value in valueArray, then the second in each and so on.
278     * The entries are all appended to the end of the iteration order, unless a key was already present. Then,
279     * its value is changed at the existing position in the iteration order.
280     * If the lengths of the two arrays are not equal, this puts a number of entries equal to the lesser length.
281     * If either array is null, this returns without performing any changes.
282     * @param keyArray an array of int keys that should usually have the same length as valueArray
283     * @param valueArray an array of int values that should usually have the same length as keyArray
284     */
285    public void putAll(final int[] keyArray, final double[] valueArray)
286    {
287        if(keyArray == null || valueArray == null)
288            return;
289        for (int i = 0; i < keyArray.length && i < valueArray.length; i++)
290            put(keyArray[i], valueArray[i]);
291
292    }
293
294    /**
295     * Puts all key-value pairs in the Map m into this OrderedMap.
296     * The entries are all appended to the end of the iteration order, unless a key was already present. Then,
297     * its value is changed at the existing position in the iteration order. This can take any kind of Map,
298     * including unordered HashMap objects; if the Map does not have stable ordering, the order in which entries
299     * will be appended is not stable either. For this reason, OrderedMap, LinkedHashMap, and TreeMap (or other
300     * SortedMap implementations) will work best when order matters.
301     * @param m an IntIntOrderedMap to add into this
302     */
303    public void putAll(IntDoubleOrderedMap m) {
304        if (f <= .5)
305            ensureCapacity(m.size()); // The resulting map will be sized for m.size() elements
306        else
307            tryCapacity(size() + m.size()); // The resulting map will be size() +  m.size() elements
308        int n = m.size();
309        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {             
310            put(m.keyAt(i), m.getAt(i));
311        }
312    }
313    private int insert(final int k, final double v) {
314        int pos;
315        if (k == 0) {
316            if (containsNullKey)
317                return n;
318            containsNullKey = true;
319            pos = n;
320        } else {
321            int curr;
322            final int[] key = this.key;
323            // The starting point.
324            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) != 0) {
325                if (curr == k)
326                    return pos;
327                while ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) != 0)
328                    if (curr == k)
329                        return pos;
330            }
331        }
332        key[pos] = k;
333        value[pos] = v;
334        order.add(pos);
335        if (size++ >= maxFill)
336            rehash(arraySize(size + 1, f));
337        return -1;
338    }
339    private int insertAt(final int k, final double v, final int idx) {
340        int pos;
341        if (k == 0) {
342            if (containsNullKey)
343            {
344                fixOrder(n);
345                order.insert(idx, n);
346                return n;
347            }
348            containsNullKey = true;
349            pos = n;
350        } else {
351            int curr;
352            final int[] key = this.key;
353            // The starting point.
354            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) != 0) {
355                if (curr == k)
356                {
357                    fixOrder(pos);
358                    order.insert(idx, pos);
359                    return pos;
360                }
361                while ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) != 0)
362                    if (curr == k)
363                    {
364                        fixOrder(pos);
365                        order.insert(idx, pos);
366                        return pos;
367                    }
368            }
369        }
370        key[pos] = k;
371        value[pos] = v;
372        order.insert(idx, pos);
373        if (size++ >= maxFill)
374            rehash(arraySize(size + 1, f));
375        return -1;
376    }
377    public double put(final int k, final double v) {
378        final int pos = insert(k, v);
379        if (pos < 0)
380            return defRetValue;
381        final double oldValue = value[pos];
382        value[pos] = v;
383        return oldValue;
384    }
385    public double putAt(final int k, final double v, final int idx) {
386        final int pos = insertAt(k, v, idx);
387        if (pos < 0)
388            return defRetValue;
389        final double oldValue = value[pos];
390        value[pos] = v;
391        return oldValue;
392    }
393    /**
394     * Shifts left entries with the specified hash code, starting at the
395     * specified position, and empties the resulting free entry.
396     *
397     * @param pos
398     *            a starting position.
399     */
400    protected final void shiftKeys(int pos) {
401        // Shift entries with the same hash.
402        int last, slot;
403        int curr;
404        final int[] key = this.key;
405        for (;;) {
406            pos = ((last = pos) + 1) & mask;
407            for (;;) {
408                if ((curr = key[pos]) == 0) {
409                    key[last] = 0;
410                    return;
411                }
412                slot = (HashCommon.mix(curr))
413                        & mask;
414                if (last <= pos ? last >= slot || slot > pos : last >= slot
415                        && slot > pos)
416                    break;
417                pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
418            }
419            key[last] = curr;
420            value[last] = value[pos];
421            fixOrder(pos, last);
422        }
423    }
424    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
425    public double remove(final int k) {
426        if (k == 0) {
427            if (containsNullKey)
428                return removeNullEntry();
429            return defRetValue;
430        }
431        int curr;
432        final int[] key = this.key;
433        int pos;
434        // The starting point.
435        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
436            return defRetValue;
437        if (k == curr)
438            return removeEntry(pos);
439        while (true) {
440            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
441                return defRetValue;
442            if (k == curr)
443                return removeEntry(pos);
444        }
445    }
446    private double setValue(final int pos, final double v) {
447        final double oldValue = value[pos];
448        value[pos] = v;
449        return oldValue;
450    }
451    /**
452     * Removes the mapping associated with the first key in iteration order.
453     *
454     * @return the value previously associated with the first key in iteration
455     *         order.
456     * @throws NoSuchElementException
457     *             is this map is empty.
458     */
459    public double removeFirst() {
460        return removeAt(0);
461    }
462    /**
463     * Removes the mapping associated with the last key in iteration order.
464     *
465     * @return the value previously associated with the last key in iteration
466     *         order.
467     * @throws NoSuchElementException
468     *             is this map is empty.
469     */
470    public double removeLast() {
471        return removeAt(size-1);
472    }
473    public double get(final int k) {
474        if (k == 0)
475            return containsNullKey ? value[n] : defRetValue;
476        int curr;
477        final int[] key = this.key;
478        int pos;
479        // The starting point.
480        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
481            return defRetValue;
482        if (k == curr)
483            return value[pos];
484        // There's always an unused entry.
485        while (true) {
486            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
487                return defRetValue;
488            if (k == curr)
489                return value[pos];
490        }
491    }
492
493
494    public double getOrDefault(final int k, final double defaultValue) {
495        if (k == 0)
496            return containsNullKey ? value[n] : defaultValue;
497        int curr;
498        final int[] key = this.key;
499        int pos;
500        // The starting point.
501        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
502            return defaultValue;
503        if (k == curr)
504            return value[pos];
505        // There's always an unused entry.
506        while (true) {
507            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
508                return defaultValue;
509            if (k == curr)
510                return value[pos];
511        }
512    }
513
514    protected int positionOf(final int k) {
515        if (k == 0)
516        {
517            if(containsNullKey)
518                return n;
519            else
520                return -1;
521        }
522        int curr;
523        final int[] key = this.key;
524        int pos;
525        // The starting point.
526        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
527            return -1;
528        if (k == curr)
529            return pos;
530        // There's always an unused entry.
531        while (true) {
532            if ((curr = key[pos = pos + 1 & mask]) == 0)
533                return -1;
534            if (k == curr)
535                return pos;
536        }
537    }
538
539    /**
540     * Gets the position in the ordering of the given key, though not as efficiently as some data structures can do it
541     * (e.g. {@link Arrangement} can access ordering position very quickly but doesn't store other values on its own).
542     * Returns a value that is at least 0 if it found k, or -1 if k was not present.
543     * @param k a key or possible key that this should find the index of
544     * @return the index of k, if present, or -1 if it is not present in this OrderedMap
545     */
546    public int indexOf(final int k)
547    {
548        int pos = positionOf(k);
549        return (pos < 0) ? -1 : order.indexOf(pos);
550    }
551
552    /**
553     * Swaps the positions in the ordering for the given items, if they are both present. Returns true if the ordering
554     * changed as a result of this call, or false if it stayed the same (which can be because left or right was not
555     * present, or because left and right are the same reference (so swapping would do nothing)).
556     * @param left an item that should be present in this OrderedMap
557     * @param right an item that should be present in this OrderedMap
558     * @return true if this OrderedMap changed in ordering as a result of this call, or false otherwise
559     */
560    public boolean swap(final int left, final int right)
561    {
562        if(left == right) return false;
563        int l = indexOf(left);
564        if(l < 0) return false;
565        int r = indexOf(right);
566        if(r < 0) return false;
567        order.swap(l, r);
568        return true;
569    }
570    /**
571     * Swaps the given indices in the ordering, if they are both valid int indices. Returns true if the ordering
572     * changed as a result of this call, or false if it stayed the same (which can be because left or right referred to
573     * an out-of-bounds index, or because left and right are equal (so swapping would do nothing)).
574     * @param left an index of an item in this OrderedMap, at least 0 and less than {@link #size()}
575     * @param right an index of an item in this OrderedMap, at least 0 and less than {@link #size()}
576     * @return true if this OrderedMap changed in ordering as a result of this call, or false otherwise
577     */
578    public boolean swapIndices(final int left, final int right)
579    {
580        if(left < 0 || right < 0 || left >= order.size || right >= order.size || left == right) return false;
581        order.swap(left, right);
582        return true;
583    }
584
585
586    public boolean containsKey(final int k) {
587        if (k == 0)
588            return containsNullKey;
589        int curr;
590        final int[] key = this.key;
591        int pos;
592        // The starting point.
593        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
594            return false;
595        if (k == curr)
596            return true;
597        // There's always an unused entry.
598        while (true) {
599            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
600                return false;
601            if (k == curr)
602                return true;
603        }
604    }
605    public boolean containsValue(final double v) {
606        final double[] value = this.value;
607        final int[] key = this.key;
608        if (containsNullKey && value[n] == v)
609            return true;
610        for (int i = n; i-- != 0;)
611            if (key[i] != 0 && value[i] == v)
612                return true;
613        return false;
614    }
615    /*
616     * Removes all elements from this map.
617     *
618     * <P>To increase object reuse, this method does not change the table size.
619     * If you want to reduce the table size, you must use {@link #trim()}.
620     */
621    public void clear() {
622        if (size == 0)
623            return;
624        size = 0;
625        containsNullKey = false;
626        Arrays.fill(key, 0);
627        order.clear();
628    }
629
630    public int size() {
631        return size;
632    }
633
634    public boolean isEmpty() {
635        return size == 0;
636    }
637
638    /**
639     * Looks up the key {@code k} in this map, remembers the associated value (which will be
640     * {@link #defaultReturnValue()} if k wasn't found), adds {@code increment} to the actual associated value in the
641     * map, and returns the remembered value.
642     * @param k a key to look up
643     * @param increment a double to add to the value associated with {@code k}
644     * @return the previous value associated with k, or {@link #defaultReturnValue()} if k wasn't found
645     */
646    public double getAndIncrement(int k, double increment) {
647        if (k == 0) {
648            if (containsNullKey) {
649                double got = value[n];
650                value[n] += increment;
651                return got;
652            } else {
653                value[n] = defRetValue + increment;
654                return defRetValue;
655            }
656        }
657        int curr;
658        final int[] key = this.key;
659        int pos;
660        // The starting point.
661        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
662        {
663            put(k, defRetValue + increment);
664            return defRetValue;
665        }
666        if (k == curr)
667        {
668            double got = value[pos];
669            value[pos] += increment;
670            return got;
671        }
672        // There's always an unused entry.
673        while (true) {
674            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
675            {
676                put(k, defRetValue + increment);
677                return defRetValue;
678            }
679            if (k == curr)
680            {
681                double got = value[pos];
682                value[pos] += increment;
683                return got;
684            }
685        }
686    }
687
688    /**
689     * The entry class for a OrderedMap does not record key and value, but rather the position in the hash table of the corresponding entry. This is necessary so that calls to
690     * {@link MapEntry#setValue(double)} are reflected in the map
691     */
692    public final class MapEntry {
693        // The table index this entry refers to, or -1 if this entry has been
694        // deleted.
695        int index;
696        MapEntry(final int index) {
697            this.index = index;
698        }
699        MapEntry() {
700        }
701        public int getKey() {
702            return key[index];
703        }
704        public double getValue() {
705            return value[index];
706        }
707        public double setValue(final double v) {
708            final double oldValue = value[index];
709            value[index] = v;
710            return oldValue;
711        }
712        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
713        public boolean equals(final Object o) {
714            if (!(o instanceof MapEntry))
715                return false;
716            MapEntry e = (MapEntry) o;
717            return (key[index] == e.getKey())
718                    && (value[index] == e.getValue());
719        }
720        public int hashCode() {
721            return HashCommon.mix(key[index])
722                    ^ HashCommon.mix(NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(value[index]));
723        }
724        @Override
725        public String toString() {
726            return key[index] + "=>" + value[index];
727        }
728    }
729
730    /**
731     * Modifies the ordering so that the given entry is removed. This method will complete in logarithmic time.
732     *
733     * @param i the index of an entry.
734     * @return the iteration-order index of the removed entry
735     */
736    protected int fixOrder(final int i) {
737        if (size == 0) {
738            order.clear();
739            return -1;
740        }
741        return order.removeValue(i);
742    }
743
744    /**
745     * Modifies the ordering for a shift from s to d.
746     * <br>
747     * This method will complete in logarithmic time or better.
748     *
749     * @param s the source position.
750     * @param d the destination position.
751     */
752    protected void fixOrder(int s, int d) {
753        if(size == 0)
754            return;
755        if (size == 1 || order.items[0] == s) {
756            order.set(0, d);
757        }
758        else if (order.items[order.size-1] == s) {
759            order.set(order.size - 1, d);
760        }
761        else
762        {
763            order.set(order.indexOf(s), d);
764        }
765    }
766
767    /**
768     * Returns the first key of this map in iteration order.
769     *
770     * @return the first key in iteration order.
771     */
772    public int firstKey() {
773        if (size == 0)
774            throw new NoSuchElementException();
775        return key[order.items[0]];
776    }
777    /**
778     * Returns the last key of this map in iteration order.
779     *
780     * @return the last key in iteration order.
781     */
782    public int lastKey() {
783        if (size == 0)
784            throw new NoSuchElementException();
785        return key[order.items[order.size-1]];
786    }
787    /**
788     * A list iterator over a OrderedMap.
789     *
790     * <P>
791     * This class provides a list iterator over a OrderedMap. The
792     * constructor runs in constant time.
793     */
794    private class MapIterator {
795        /**
796         * The entry that will be returned by the next call to
797         * {@link ListIterator#previous()} (or <code>null</code> if no
798         * previous entry exists).
799         */
800        int prev = -1;
801        /**
802         * The entry that will be returned by the next call to
803         * {@link ListIterator#next()} (or <code>null</code> if no
804         * next entry exists).
805         */
806        int next = -1;
807        /**
808         * The last entry that was returned (or -1 if we did not iterate or used
809         * {@link Iterator#remove()}).
810         */
811        int curr = -1;
812        /**
813         * The current index (in the sense of a {@link ListIterator}).
814         * Note that this value is not meaningful when this iterator has been
815         * created using the nonempty constructor.
816         */
817        int index = 0;
818        private MapIterator() {
819            next = size == 0 ? -1 : order.items[0];
820            index = 0;
821        }
822        /*
823        private MapIterator(final K from) {
824            if (((from) == null)) {
825                if (containsNullKey) {
826                    next = (int) link[n];
827                    prev = n;
828                    return;
829                } else
830                    throw new NoSuchElementException("The key null"
831                            + " does not belong to this map.");
832            }
833            if (((key[last]) != null && (key[last]).equals(from))) {
834                prev = last;
835                index = size;
836                return;
837            }
838            // The starting point.
839            int pos = (((from).hashCode()))
840                    & mask;
841            // There's always an unused entry.
842            while (!((key[pos]) == null)) {
843                if (((key[pos]).equals(from))) {
844                    // Note: no valid index known.
845                    next = (int) link[pos];
846                    prev = pos;
847                    return;
848                }
849                pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
850            }
851            throw new NoSuchElementException("The key " + from
852                    + " does not belong to this map.");
853        }*/
854        public boolean hasNext() {
855            return next != -1;
856        }
857        public boolean hasPrevious() {
858            return prev != -1;
859        }
860        private void ensureIndexKnown() {
861            if (index >= 0)
862                return;
863            if (prev == -1) {
864                index = 0;
865                return;
866            }
867            if (next == -1) {
868                index = size;
869                return;
870            }
871            index = 0;
872            /*while (pos != prev) {
873                pos = (int) link[pos];
874                index++;
875            }*/
876        }
877        public int nextIndex() {
878            ensureIndexKnown();
879            return index + 1;
880        }
881        public int previousIndex() {
882            ensureIndexKnown();
883            return index - 1;
884        }
885        public int nextEntry() {
886            if (!hasNext())
887                throw new NoSuchElementException();
888            curr = next;
889            if(++index >= order.size)
890                next = -1;
891            else
892                next = order.get(index);//(int) link[curr];
893            prev = curr;
894            return curr;
895        }
896        public int previousEntry() {
897            if (!hasPrevious())
898                throw new NoSuchElementException();
899            curr = prev;
900            if(--index < 1)
901                prev = -1;
902            else
903                prev = order.get(index - 1);
904            //prev = (int) (link[curr] >>> 32);
905            next = curr;
906            return curr;
907        }
908        public void remove() {
909            ensureIndexKnown();
910            if (curr == -1)
911                throw new IllegalStateException();
912            if (curr == prev) {
913                /*
914                 * If the last operation was a next(), we are removing an entry
915                 * that precedes the current index, and thus we must decrement
916                 * it.
917                 */
918                if(--index >= 1)
919                    prev = order.get(index - 1); //(int) (link[curr] >>> 32);
920                else
921                    prev = -1;
922            } else {
923                if(index < order.size - 1)
924                    next = order.get(index + 1);
925                else
926                    next = -1;
927            }
928            order.removeIndex(index);
929            size--;
930            int last, slot, pos = curr;
931            curr = -1;
932            if (pos == n) {
933                containsNullKey = false;
934            } else {
935                int curr;
936                final int[] key = IntDoubleOrderedMap.this.key;
937                // We have to horribly duplicate the shiftKeys() code because we
938                // need to update next/prev.
939                for (;;) {
940                    pos = ((last = pos) + 1) & mask;
941                    for (;;) {
942                        if ((curr = key[pos]) == 0) {
943                            key[last] = 0;
944                            return;
945                        }
946                        slot = (HashCommon.mix(curr)) & mask;
947                        if (last <= pos
948                                ? last >= slot || slot > pos
949                                : last >= slot && slot > pos)
950                            break;
951                        pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
952                    }
953                    key[last] = curr;
954                    value[last] = value[pos];
955                    if (next == pos)
956                        next = last;
957                    if (prev == pos)
958                        prev = last;
959                    fixOrder(pos, last);
960                }
961            }
962        }
963        public int skip(final int n) {
964            int i = n;
965            while (i-- != 0 && hasNext())
966                nextEntry();
967            return n - i - 1;
968        }
969        public int back(final int n) {
970            int i = n;
971            while (i-- != 0 && hasPrevious())
972                previousEntry();
973            return n - i - 1;
974        }
975    }
976    private class EntryIterator extends MapIterator
977            implements
978            Iterator<MapEntry>, Serializable {
979        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
980
981        private MapEntry entry;
982        public EntryIterator() {
983        }
984        public MapEntry next() {
985            return entry = new MapEntry(nextEntry());
986        }
987        public MapEntry previous() {
988            return entry = new MapEntry(previousEntry());
989        }
990        @Override
991        public void remove() {
992            super.remove();
993            entry.index = -1; // You cannot use a deleted entry.
994        }
995    }
996
997    public class FastEntryIterator extends MapIterator implements ListIterator<MapEntry>, Serializable {
998        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
999
1000        final MapEntry entry = new MapEntry();
1001
1002        public FastEntryIterator() {
1003        }
1004        public MapEntry next() {
1005            entry.index = nextEntry();
1006            return entry;
1007        }
1008        public MapEntry previous() {
1009            entry.index = previousEntry();
1010            return entry;
1011        }
1012        public void set(MapEntry ok) {
1013            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1014        }
1015        public void add(MapEntry ok) {
1016            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1017        }
1018    }
1019    public final class MapEntrySet
1020            implements Cloneable, SortedSet<MapEntry>, Set<MapEntry>, Serializable {
1021        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1022        public EntryIterator iterator() {
1023            return new EntryIterator();
1024        }
1025        public Comparator<? super MapEntry> comparator() {
1026            return null;
1027        }
1028        public SortedSet<MapEntry> subSet(
1029                MapEntry fromElement,
1030                MapEntry toElement) {
1031            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1032        }
1033        public SortedSet<MapEntry> headSet(
1034                MapEntry toElement) {
1035            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1036        }
1037        public SortedSet<MapEntry> tailSet(
1038                MapEntry fromElement) {
1039            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1040        }
1041        public MapEntry first() {
1042            if (size == 0)
1043                throw new NoSuchElementException();
1044            return new MapEntry(order.items[0]);
1045        }
1046        public MapEntry last() {
1047            if (size == 0)
1048                throw new NoSuchElementException();
1049            return new MapEntry(order.items[order.size-1]);
1050        }
1051        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1052        public boolean contains(final Object o) {
1053            if (!(o instanceof MapEntry))
1054                return false;
1055            final MapEntry e = (MapEntry) o;
1056            final int k = e.getKey();
1057            final double v = e.getValue();
1058            if (k == 0)
1059                return containsNullKey && (value[n] == v);
1060            int curr;
1061            final int[] key = IntDoubleOrderedMap.this.key;
1062            int pos;
1063            // The starting point.
1064            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
1065                return false;
1066            if (k == curr)
1067                return value[pos] == v;
1068            // There's always an unused entry.
1069            while (true) {
1070                if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
1071                    return false;
1072                if (k == curr)
1073                    return value[pos] == v;
1074            }
1075        }
1076        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1077        public boolean remove(final Object o) {
1078            if (!(o instanceof MapEntry))
1079                return false;
1080            final MapEntry e = (MapEntry) o;
1081            final int k = e.getKey();
1082            final double v = e.getValue();
1083            if (k == 0) {
1084                if (containsNullKey && value[n] == v) {
1085                    removeNullEntry();
1086                    return true;
1087                }
1088                return false;
1089            }
1090            int curr;
1091            final int[] key = IntDoubleOrderedMap.this.key;
1092            int pos;
1093            // The starting point.
1094            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
1095                return false;
1096            if (curr == k) {
1097                if (value[pos] == v) {
1098                    removeEntry(pos);
1099                    return true;
1100                }
1101                return false;
1102            }
1103            while (true) {
1104                if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
1105                    return false;
1106                if (curr == k) {
1107                    if (value[pos] == v) {
1108                        removeEntry(pos);
1109                        return true;
1110                    }
1111                }
1112            }
1113        }
1114        public int size() {
1115            return size;
1116        }
1117        public void clear() {
1118            IntDoubleOrderedMap.this.clear();
1119        }
1120
1121        public FastEntryIterator fastIterator() {
1122            return new FastEntryIterator();
1123        }
1124
1125        @Override
1126        public boolean equals(final Object o) {
1127            if (o == this)
1128                return true;
1129            if (!(o instanceof Set))
1130                return false;
1131            Set<?> s = (Set<?>) o;
1132            return s.size() == size() && containsAll(s);
1133        }
1134
1135        public Object[] toArray() {
1136            final Object[] a = new Object[size()];
1137            objectUnwrap(iterator(), a);
1138            return a;
1139        }
1140
1141        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1142        public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a) {
1143            if (a == null || a.length < size()) a = (T[]) new Object[size()];
1144            objectUnwrap(iterator(), a);
1145            return a;
1146        }
1147
1148        /**
1149         * Unsupported.
1150         *
1151         * @param c ignored
1152         * @return nothing, throws UnsupportedOperationException
1153         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException always
1154         */
1155        public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends MapEntry> c) {
1156            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("addAll not supported");
1157        }
1158
1159        /**
1160         * Unsupported.
1161         *
1162         * @param k ignored
1163         * @return nothing, throws UnsupportedOperationException
1164         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException always
1165         */
1166        public boolean add(MapEntry k) {
1167            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("add not supported");
1168        }
1169
1170        /**
1171         * Checks whether this collection contains all elements from the given
1172         * collection.
1173         *
1174         * @param c a collection.
1175         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection contains all elements of the
1176         * argument.
1177         */
1178        public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c) {
1179            int n = c.size();
1180            final Iterator<?> i = c.iterator();
1181            while (n-- != 0)
1182                if (!contains(i.next()))
1183                    return false;
1184            return true;
1185        }
1186
1187        /**
1188         * Retains in this collection only elements from the given collection.
1189         *
1190         * @param c a collection.
1191         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the
1192         * call.
1193         */
1194        public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
1195            boolean retVal = false;
1196            int n = size();
1197            final Iterator<?> i = iterator();
1198            while (n-- != 0) {
1199                if (!c.contains(i.next())) {
1200                    i.remove();
1201                    retVal = true;
1202                }
1203            }
1204            return retVal;
1205        }
1206
1207        /**
1208         * Remove from this collection all elements in the given collection. If the
1209         * collection is an instance of this class, it uses faster iterators.
1210         *
1211         * @param c a collection.
1212         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the
1213         * call.
1214         */
1215        public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {
1216            boolean retVal = false;
1217            int n = c.size();
1218            final Iterator<?> i = c.iterator();
1219            while (n-- != 0)
1220                if (remove(i.next()))
1221                    retVal = true;
1222            return retVal;
1223        }
1224
1225        public boolean isEmpty() {
1226            return size() == 0;
1227        }
1228
1229        @Override
1230        public String toString() {
1231            final StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder();
1232            final EntryIterator i = iterator();
1233            int n = size();
1234            MapEntry k;
1235            boolean first = true;
1236            s.append("{");
1237            while (n-- != 0) {
1238                if (first)
1239                    first = false;
1240                else
1241                    s.append(", ");
1242                k = i.next();                 
1243                s.append(key[k.index]).append("=>").append(value[k.index]);
1244            }
1245            s.append("}");
1246            return s.toString();
1247        }
1248
1249    }
1250
1251    public SortedSet<MapEntry> entrySet() {
1252        if (entries == null) entries = new MapEntrySet();
1253        return entries;
1254    }
